title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The figure above shows three graphs, labeled I, II, and III. One is the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, one is the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, and one is the graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>. Which of the following correctly identifies each of the three graphs?

choices.label: The graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is I, the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup></math> is II, and the graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> is III.

The graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is I, the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup></math> is III, and the graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> is II.

The graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is II, the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup></math> is I, and the graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> is III.

The graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is II, the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup></math> is III, and the graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> is I.

content.answer: The graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is I, the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup></math> is II, and the graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> is III.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
